author: Nate Scott
title: Nearly every NBA GM would take Anthony Davis as franchise player over LeBron and Kevin Durant
text:
Nearly every NBA GM would take Anthony Davis as franchise player over LeBron and Kevin Durant USA Today Sports 16 hrs ago Nate Scott © Provided by USA Today Sports (USA TODAY Sports) If you were going to start an NBA franchise tomorrow and needed one player to build around, NBA general managers have a consensus on who that should be: Anthony Davis.
AdChoices In a poll of NBA GMs that is currently up at NBA.com , 86.2% of GMs polled said they’d want Davis if they had to start a franchise today and could sign any player. Tied for second and third on the list were Kevin Durant and LeBron James, who each received 6.9% of the vote.
This is a pretty staggering change from last year, when James came out on top for this question, with 50% of GMs saying they’d want to build around the Cavaliers star.
But James is 30 years old, settling into the latter-half of his career. He’s still a dominant player (and the GMs’ pick for who they most feel will be MVP this year) but this question is about starting a franchise.
Davis is 22 years old. He’s already an All-Star and will be first-team All Defense for the foreseeable future. He’s got a legit shot to win both NBA MVP and Defensive Player of the Year this year and, again, he’s only 22 years old.
A lot of people expected Davis to make the leap, but I’m not sure anyone thought he would make it this soon. And for that reason, he’s the guy NBA GMs would want to build around.
You can see all the results of the poll over at NBA.com .
